intro: Arthrosolen paludosus, commonly known as the swamp sandmat, is a flowering plant native to wetland environments in the southeastern United States. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its small, white to pale yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, sandy soils and is often found in marshes and along the edges of ponds. It has a low, spreading growth habit with hairy stems and leaves that are usually divided into narrow segments. Arthrosolen paludosus plays a role in stabilizing soil in wetland habitats and provides nectar for various pollinators.
